metadata.synopsis: Upon entering the Ketheric boss chamber on the lower floor of the Colony, the party will see a cinematic of the Chosen Three gearing up to continue on to the next stage of their master plan. Ketheric, Orin and Gortash will be discussing the next steps and the tension caused by the player's actions. Ketheric tadpoles Duke Ravengard and we lay eyes upon the Elder Brain in the flesh. Orin and Gortash depart with the Duke and the Elder Brain in a nearby Nautiloid to march onto Baldur's Gate. We see the Nautiloid appear above Moonrise Towers and cue the armies of the Absolute to start marching. Ketheric stays behind to deal with some local issues.
metadata.how_to_trigger: loadlevel SCL_Main_A ; goto 833 -47 -25The Chosen Three cinematic will play upon entering the large trigger here (S_COL_KethericShowdown_ChosenThree_Box_1581a588-b69f-41c9-a591-5959751f3cdf). Entering this trigger also initializes the boss chamber and the NPCs inside correctly.

55.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
55.text: You said it was under control.

64.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
64.text: You said it was under control.
64.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric and Gortash stand by the chamber's centre, squaring off. Nearby, Orin completes the circle, sitting at her leisure on Ravengard by the brine pool.

10.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
10.text: It isn't you I answer to, Gortash.

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *There he is: the man who sold you to Zariel to live out your days in the Hells.*

69.speaker: Karlach
69.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach Companion/Orphan Origin MomentNodeContext: To herself, but with shock. This is the guy who sold her to Hell and she's absolutely shocked to see him here.

54.speaker: Player
54.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach Companion/Orphan Origin MomentNodeContext: To herself, but with shock. This is the guy who sold her to Hell and she's absolutely shocked to see him here.

39.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
39.text: Oh, the General voice. Is this where we salute?
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: At mention of his daughter, Ketheric growls and darts at Gortash with his fist raised.NodeContext: Snarling growl - not a spoken word

50.speaker: Orin
50.text: Salute, yes, with cleavers through his blood-starved flesh. How it crawls with failure like flies on lick-wet carrion.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: At mention of his daughter, Ketheric growls and darts at Gortash with his fist raised.NodeContext: Snarling growl - not a spoken word

87.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
87.text: You forget yourself, Orin. I have played my part.
87.context: CinematicNodeContext: At mention of his daughter, Ketheric growls and darts at Gortash with his fist raised.NodeContext: Snarling growl - not a spoken word

7.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
7.text: You've built an army for our masters, true enough. But what of the Astral Prism?
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: At mention of his daughter, Ketheric growls and darts at Gortash with his fist raised.NodeContext: Snarling growl - not a spoken word

6.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
6.text: A rogue True Soul, flaunting it under your very nose. And you almost missed it.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: At mention of his daughter, Ketheric growls and darts at Gortash with his fist raised.NodeContext: Snarling growl - not a spoken word

43.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
43.text: Balthazar has them now. He'll deliver the Prism soon enough - so if you would cease these distractions, I -
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: At mention of his daughter, Ketheric growls and darts at Gortash with his fist raised.NodeContext: Snarling growl - not a spoken word

14.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
14.text: The distractions have been yours, Ketheric. Perhaps we never should have dug your daughter up.
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: At mention of his daughter, Ketheric growls and darts at Gortash with his fist raised.NodeContext: Snarling growl - not a spoken word

47.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: At mention of his daughter, Ketheric growls and darts at Gortash with his fist raised.NodeContext: Snarling growl - not a spoken word

58.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
58.text: So you haven't lost your edge. But you're still not as sharp as Orin is, I wager.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric stops short an inch from Gortash's face, who only grins wider. We pan around to see Orin casually pressing a knife to Ketheric's chest. She closed the distance with incredible speed.

93.text: The slayer against the undying one. That would be fun to see.
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: She reluctantly puts away her knife.NodeContext: Orin reluctantly puts away her knife

74.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
74.text: The slayer against the undying one. That would be fun to see.
74.context: CinematicNodeContext: She reluctantly puts away her knife.NodeContext: Orin reluctantly puts away her knife

86.speaker: Orin
86.text: His cryptbreath sings to my sinews, again again againagainagain!
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: She reluctantly puts away her knife.NodeContext: Orin reluctantly puts away her knife

61.speaker: Orin
61.text: But he must lead the murdermarch to Baldur's Grave.
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: She reluctantly puts away her knife.NodeContext: Orin reluctantly puts away her knife

44.text: If the weapon is truly in your grasp, Ketheric, might I suggest closing your fist?
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: Smirking, Gortash brings his hand up, a gauntlet shining on his fist.

53.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
53.text: If the weapon is truly in your grasp, Ketheric, might I suggest closing your fist?
53.context: CinematicNodeContext: Smirking, Gortash brings his hand up, a gauntlet shining on his fist.

34.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
34.text: Orin and I can wait for you no longer. The plan proceeds - we're going to the city, and we expect you to follow - army and the weapon in tow.
34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash turns to the face the brine pool, holding his gauntlet aloft, the gem inlaid in it glinting. Rolling her eyes, Orin raises her dagger, its gem glinting alike. The surface of the brine pool begins to bubble.

96.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: He raises his gauntlet to display the netherstone inlaid therein. It glows,

56.speaker: Orin
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: She raises her dagger to display the netherstone inlaid therein. It glows.

88.context: CinematicNodeContext: From the boiling surface of the brine pool, a MASSIVE SHAPE emerges. Tentacles writhing, the ELDER BRAIN hangs suspended. Gortash smiles - but then his face tightens in strain as the Brain TREMBLES, resisting.

92.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash waits for Ketheric without turning around. Seething, Ketheric is slow to comply - but he does comply, striking a pose with an identical gem aloft on his chest. A CROWN atop the Brain sparks, glowing with the same light as the rings.

94.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric raises his chest slightly, where the jewelled centrepiece therein begins to glow.

1.text: An elder brain... one of the cruellest and most powerful creatures in existence, enslaved by mere mortals.

23.text: An elder brain... one of the cruellest and most powerful creatures in existence, enslaved by mere mortals.

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *The sight of the crown atop the elder brain strikes you like lightning. Never before have you beheld an artefact of such unrivalled power.*

76.speaker: Narrator
76.text: *The sight of the crown atop the elder brain strikes you like lightning. Never before have you beheld an artefact of such unrivalled power.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *You realise that it could change everything. Your own course. Your own life. The destiny of worlds.*
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *But here, in this very moment lies your chance to heed Mystra's call. This must be it: the end of the Absolute.*
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: It's one thing to sacrifice yourself, but you will not sacrifice your friends. You will wait - there will be another chance.
89.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Or the beginning of something else... You will not die today.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *The orb senses your hesitation. It shudders within you - longing for something, though you cannot tell what.*

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *A prickling dread rises along your spine - you have disobeyed Mystra. Again. If you survive this, there will be consequences.*

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Obey your goddess. Detonate the orb. Destroy the Absolute.
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

17.text: *Beneath the smoking ashes of Moonrise Towers, the elder brain lies destroyed. But what of the tadpoles it commanded?*
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *Beneath the smoking ashes of Moonrise Towers, the elder brain lies destroyed. But what of the tadpoles it commanded?*

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *Freed of the Absolute's control, they will complete their transformations. A plague of illithids will soon descend on the Sword Coast, enslaving all they do not infect.*

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *It is an ending, of sorts. Though not the one destiny had in store for you.*

33.speaker: Gale
33.text: Look at that crown. It radiates with power unlike anything I've ever seen. To have it... to hold... If only I could...

68.speaker: Gale
68.text: But I can't... This is it. I must do as Mystra commands.
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brain extends a tentacle, and we follow it down to a slumped and bound Duke Ravengard.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Gale, you cannot do this. You can't condemn us to death.
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brain extends a tentacle, and we follow it down to a slumped and bound Duke Ravengard.

73.speaker: Gale
73.text: What choice do I have? More than just a goddess counts on my courage: whole worlds hang in the balance.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brain extends a tentacle, and we follow it down to a slumped and bound Duke Ravengard.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: You could choose me, the one who loves you. We can find another way together.
21.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brain extends a tentacle, and we follow it down to a slumped and bound Duke Ravengard.

97.speaker: Gale
97.text: I love you too. Much more than myself. More even than Mystra.

20.speaker: Gale
20.text: Very well. Whether I condemn this world or not: I choose you.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Please, Gale. It can't end like this. We can find another way. Together.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brain extends a tentacle, and we follow it down to a slumped and bound Duke Ravengard.

59.speaker: Gale
59.text: I... I have no desire to end your life, you know that.
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brain extends a tentacle, and we follow it down to a slumped and bound Duke Ravengard.

26.speaker: Gale
26.text: To end it... To struggle on... It is a grave choice you're making for us both, but if it must be so - very well, I'll stand down to stand by you.
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brain extends a tentacle, and we follow it down to a slumped and bound Duke Ravengard.

41.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
41.text: There we are. It wouldn't do to fight in front of our guest.
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Brain extends a tentacle, and we follow it down to a slumped and bound Duke Ravengard.

70.speaker: Orin
70.text: You wag your wordflap in vain, Ulderling. Once the worm holds the whip, your shredded flesh will serve us.
70.context: CinematicNodeContext: Orin stoops to speak in Ravengard's ear. As she speaks, the tentacle unfurls to reveal a tadpole. Almost delicately, it's pressed against his eye and wriggles out of sight. He collapses, twitching.NodeContext: Orin stoops to speak in Ravengard's ear.

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *You freeze at the sight. Your own father, Duke Ulder Ravengard, seized by the Chosen. Yet for now, there's little you can do.*
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash claps his hands, all energetic once more. He steps around the convulsing Ravengard and shoos at Ketheric, who steps back with a grimace.

80.speaker: Narrator
80.text: *Wyll freezes at the sight. His own father, Duke Ulder Ravengard, seized by the Chosen. Yet for now, there's little he can do.*
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash claps his hands, all energetic once more. He steps around the convulsing Ravengard and shoos at Ketheric, who steps back with a grimace.

28.speaker: Wyll
28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash claps his hands, all energetic once more. He steps around the convulsing Ravengard and shoos at Ketheric, who steps back with a grimace.

18.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
18.text: Now! It's really time we were going.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash claps his hands, all energetic once more. He steps around the convulsing Ravengard and shoos at Ketheric, who steps back with a grimace.

32.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
32.text: We will empty this place and begin the march. You may catch up with the army once you've retrieved the weapon.
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Tremors loosen stones from the rock wall as the brain pulls upwards

72.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
72.text: And Ketheric - do try not to sulk. You're supposed to be the fearsome General, come to conquer the city.
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises his voice slightly as the sound around grows. The brain begins to glow, ready to plane-shift, tentacles outstretching towards Orin and Gortash.

46.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
46.text: And I am the hero who will save it.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash gives a mocking wave as the tentacle reaches him, touching him, the glowing building - then grows BLINDING as the brain departs, plane-shifting Gortash, Ravengard and Orin with it. Still scowling, Ketheric turns away.

67.text: It is time, faithful ones. March on Baldur's Gate. We go to prepare the way.
67.context: CinematicNodeContext: The brain and other nautiloids materialise above Moonrise, still ringed in light.  The Absolute's voice booms from within, the brain coiling its tentacles around Moonrise towers. As it does, we see soldiers straighten and prepare to leave - conspicously - not a single one looks at the brain.

25.context: CinematicNodeContext: The light builds to a BLINDING AURA as  the brain shifts again, leaving only the marching army, nautiloids moving to follow.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Trust me, Gale. We'll find another way.
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

78.speaker: Gale
78.text: I do trust you. More than myself right now. Perhaps even more than Mystra.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Stand down! This isn't your decision to make.
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: You're right... we truly have no other choice. This is it, then - the end of ends.
45.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

60.speaker: Gale
60.text: One last gust of Weave. One last gale to end them all.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

5.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

37.text: *Beneath the smoking ashes of Moonrise Towers, the elder brain lies destroyed. But what of the tadpoles it commanded?*
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: We fade to black and hear the sound of a huge explosion. We fade out and see a painting of Elminster looking over the distant ruins of Moonrise Towers, completely toppled. Mystra’s will was done, and the threat of the Absolute is over, but it cost our heroes their lives.

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *Beneath the smoking ashes of Moonrise Towers, the elder brain lies destroyed. But what of the tadpoles it commanded?*

19.speaker: Narrator
19.text: *Freed of the Absolute's control, they will complete their transformations. A plague of illithids will soon descend on the Sword Coast, enslaving all they do not infect.*

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *It is an ending, of sorts. Though not the one destiny had in store for you.*

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Go ahead. We stand no chance against such forces. Let's end this together.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Look at that crown. It radiates with power unlike anything I've ever seen. To have it... to hold... If only I could...

15.speaker: Player
15.text: But I can't... This is it. I must do as Mystra commands.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: One last gust of Weave. One last gale to end them all.

95.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
95.text: A rogue True Soul, flaunting it under your nose all this time. And you ran from them.

79.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
79.text: Sure that they would follow, and deliver it into my hands here. If you would cease these distractions -
